title: "Targeted stiffening yields more efficient soft robot arms"
excerpt: "Observers can see the concept of variable stiffening at play in nature. The sea cucumber uses stiffening to save itself from predators, hardening its shell in an instant when threatened. Sea cucumbers exhibit flexibility when burrowing themselves in the muddy sea floor, but stiffen up when they need to anchor in place."
